sources.title: A Xinjiang Solar Giant Breaks Ranks to Try and Woo the West
sources.snippet: At the Daqo New Energy Corp. factory in China's Xinjiang region, workers carefully processed tall columns of refined silicon last week as a group of reporters and analysts looked on. It's the first time outsiders were allowed to witness the mundane factory scene since China's dominant solar industry has come under scrutiny for its labor practices.

sources.title: Xinjiang Issue: A look inside a Daqo New Energy facility, the ...
sources.snippet: Daqo New Energy is a leading maker of high-purity polysilicon, a key material for the global solar panel industry. It's been slapped with an import ban by the US for their alleged links to human rights abuses in Xinjiang. The New York-listed company has denied the claims, and so has China. Our reporter Wei Lynn Tang visits Daqo's factory in Xinjiang and brings us this report.
